channel.title: Packets
channel.description:
Alright, usually I do not post here, but I'm writing networking for my server and I don't understand the packets. A packet has an opcode. I got that. A packet has a length. That means how many bytes the packet is. Got that too.
And a packet has a type (fixed, variable short, variable byte). wdf is dat?.
Need to know what a packet type is. :D

item.title: Packets
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

Hmm, okay. But what does fixed, variable short and variable byte mean then?

Read full topic

item.title: Packets
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

it’s what type of data is inside the packet

Read full topic
